intro: Brachystelma kituloense, commonly known as the Kitulo starwort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude grasslands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming during the dry season. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain water in arid environments. Brachystelma kituloense is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, making it a unique component of the Ethiopian highland flora.
